text: hi everyone today recipe is very quick
and simple we are making coconut Penang
waffles it has a nice golden brown and
green color and great flavor of coconut
and pang pang which I'm sure you will
for enough at the first try so let's
begin
in a large mixing bowl crack one egg and
build it for about 30 seconds or until
it's nice and fluffy then add in 300 ml
coconut milk that is about one and a
quarter cup stir to incorporate the two
ingredients together then add in about a
quarter teaspoon of pandan extract which
will give the cake a nice green color
and beautiful me pending aroma still
wear again and you will see your batter
turn into nice green color for the dry
ingredients you will need one cup of
all-purpose flour 2 tablespoon of
cornstarch but will make your waffle
more crispy 1/3 cup of granulated sugar
of course you can adjust the sugar
amount to your taste we also need half a
cup coconut flakes a teaspoon of baking
powder and 1/4 teaspoon of salt then mix
it all up and we're going to combine the
dry ingredients with the wet ingredients
I'm adding in two batches so that is
easier to mix and avoid big pockets of
flour
when finished mixing you will get a cut
out thick matter and just let it rest
for about ten minutes meanwhile you can
preheat your waffle maker or following
manufacturer instructions then grease it
with some melted butter it will be more
convenient if you use a pastry brush but
mine was stolen by someone so I have to
do like this remember to grease the
upper part of the waffle maker as well
then scoop one ladle form of the batter
into the middle of the waffle maker this
recipe makes three waffles with a
transit centimeter or h-beam diameter
then close it and maybe hold for about
three seconds so that the batter is
distributed evenly then just wait for
him to do this job and stir when it
turned golden brown on both sides you
just take it out and let it rest on a
cooling rack for a few minutes the
waffle is crispy on the outside and soft
and chewy with bits of coconut from the
inside you can just eat it like that or
maybe drizzle some honey or maple syrup
or powdered sugar on top
you can make this for your family on a
Saturday or Sunday morning for breakfast
and I hope that everyone will love them
thank you for watching bye bye
you
